main

Class Matrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.Matrix

  • public class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    arno A simple Matrix implementation. The entries are stored column-wise due to usually handle whole columns at once in EXILE (better performance) The matrix is dynamically adapting it's size but throws Exceptions on Dimension errors

      • getEntry

        public double getEntry(int x,
              int y)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Gets an Entry from the matrix (x,y)
        Parameters:
        x - The Line index
        y - The column index
        Returns:
        The entry stored at that position
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if (x,y) is outside the matrix dimensions or the entry isn't initialized

                                                                throws java.lang.Exception

        Parameters:
        y - the column index
        Returns:

        Throws:

      • setEntry

        protected void setEntry(int x,
            int y,
            double d)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Puts an Entry into the matrix - Only Accessible to the packet toavoid manipulative mods
        Parameters:
        x - the row index
        y - the column index
        d - the new value to be stored
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if invalid dimensions are used (e.g. negative indices) or epmpty/uninitilaized columns are in between
